alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 27 at 4:41PM EST until February 27 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD AND CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES... At 441 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Reynoldsburg, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pickerington, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Groveport, Johnstown, Utica, Hanover, Granville South, Marne, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station, Whitehall, Etna and New Albany. This includes I-70 in Ohio near mile marker 103, and between mile markers 105 and 120. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
